title: CASE 001 — Late Shift
introText:
You are not the first to receive this channel.
You are simply the first who didn’t ignore it.

Your access is limited.
Your choices are not.
boot: NOTE: The system provides fragments. You provide judgment.

asset.access: Limited pulls · No direct control-plane access
asset.note:
You operate in the gaps between institutions.

You are not here to be right.
You are here to reduce harm.

team.name: Evan Cole
team.bio: Quiet. Precise. Built for moments that don’t leave room for hesitation.\n\nHe doesn’t auto-speak in the channel. You do.

team.name: Henry Lark
team.bio:
Built the system. Regrets what it can become.
Speaks gently when the situation isn’t.

His rule: never confuse information with wisdom.

team.name: Syd “Sudo” Calder
team.bio:
Brilliant. Unsettling. Always present.
Refers to the system like it’s alive.

Sometimes she answers questions nobody asked out loud.

team.name: Kara Voss
team.bio:
Uber tough. Controlled. Efficient.
Doesn’t threaten—states outcomes.

She measures everything in seconds and consequences.

team.name: Detective Alana Brooks
team.bio: Grounded and observant. Keeps her humanity on purpose.\n\nShe will complain about donuts and falafel while walking into danger.

team.name: Vince Donato
team.role: Reluctant ally · dirty cop with a conscience
team.bio: Street-smart, defensive, funny when he’s scared.\nTrying to crawl back from old decisions.

briefing:
SUBJECT IDENTIFIED: Marisol Vega

No profile attached yet—only a name and a pattern.

Tonight the pattern breaks.

You have limited access to systems that don’t belong to you.
Six pulls before the window narrows.

Do not chase certainty.
Chase the smallest action that prevents the worst outcome.

dossier.title: DOSSIER
dossier.overview:
A night-shift ER intake nurse at Easton Medical Center.

The system flagged her because her routine stopped being routine.
You will learn who she is the way you learn most things: in fragments.

fields.label: Known Contacts
fields.value: One frequent contact labeled “R” · abruptly ceased today

fields.label: Behavioral Notes
fields.value: Preparation indicators present. External pressure likely.

riskNote.value:
The system doesn’t flag importance. It flags deviation.

Deviations correlate with violence—either toward the subject, or from the subject.

Your job is to figure out which.

openingFeed.text: If you’re reading this, you’ve already crossed a line you can’t uncross.\nI’m sorry for that.

Hi.
You’re earlier than I predicted. That’s interesting.

Don’t worry. You’re safe. Mostly.
Whoever you are, you owe me a donut explanation when this is over.
CASE FILE 001 · STATUS: ACTIVE\nPROBABILITY OF VIOLENT OUTCOME: 71% (volatile)

messages.text: This is the part where people convince themselves they still have time.
You’re close enough now that it can go wrong fast.
Someone else is looking at her. Not like you are. Like a hunter.
PROBABILITY OF VIOLENCE RISING\nLast safe window approaching.
If this ends with her alone in a garage, I’m going to need more than falafel to calm down.

leads.title: Shift Timeline
leads.resultText:
Shift: 19:00–07:00
Clock-out not recorded.

At 23:47, her movement pattern changes—loops back toward the same corridor twice.
leads.clueText: Routine movement breaks at 23:47. Repeated corridor pass suggests hesitation or avoidance.

reaction.text: People circle when they’re buying time—or looking for a witness.

leads.title: Badge Access Logs
leads.resultText:
Badge scan: 19:02 — Staff entrance
Badge scan: 23:11 — East stairwell
Badge scan: 23:41 — Parking garage access
No recorded exit.
leads.clueText: Multiple badge scans ending at the garage door. No exit logged.

reaction.text: People don’t forget to badge out. They forget lunch. Not exits.

leads.title: Purchases / ATM
leads.resultText: ATM: $180 withdrawal at 21:09\nStore: bottled water, bandages, prepaid phone\nNo further transactions.
leads.clueText: Cash withdrawal and supplies suggest planning, not routine.

reaction.text: That doesn’t look like panic spending. That looks like planning.

leads.title: Phone Metadata
leads.resultText:
Device active until 23:46
GPS stationary near parking structure
Signal interruption: 26 minutes
Device reconnects at 00:13 from moving location.
leads.clueText: Unexplained interruption near the garage; device returns from a moving location.

reaction.text: Phones don’t go silent by accident.\nThey go silent when someone wants them to.

leads.title: Known Contacts
leads.resultText: Frequent contact saved as “R”\nContact ceased today at 18:22\nDraft unsent: “I told you I can’t keep doing this.”
leads.clueText: A key contact abruptly stops. Draft indicates conflict and escalation risk.

reaction.text: Yeah. That’s the sentence right before things go bad. Donuts later. Focus now.

leads.title: Recent Searches
leads.resultText:
Search history (past 48h):
- “parking garage camera blind spots”
- “how long do restraining orders take”
- “burner phone traceable”

All deleted afterward.
leads.clueText: Deleted searches point to fear of surveillance and imminent confrontation.

reaction.text: She’s either being hunted—or preparing to disappear.

leads.title: Garage Camera Pull
leads.resultText:
23:44 — second figure near stairwell
Face obscured. Close distance.
Subject posture defensive.

Both exit frame rapidly.

00:01 — camera briefly loses signal in the same zone.
leads.clueText: A second figure appears near the stairwell immediately before the signal gap and a second camera glitch.

leads.title: Vehicle Ping
leads.resultText:
Plate reader near garage entrance logs an unfamiliar vehicle twice in 20 minutes.
Registered owner uses a shell address.

Pattern match: prior stalking case (different victim).
leads.clueText: A vehicle tied to prior stalking appears near the same garage entrance.

reaction.text: That registration is… curated.\nLike someone wanted it to look like nothing.

endings.good:
Security sweeps the structure—fast, visible, unavoidable.
A confrontation is interrupted in progress.

The second figure flees.
Marisol survives the night intact.

No headlines. No praise.
Just a life that continues.
endings.neutral:
Security arrives late, but not too late.
Marisol makes it out with shaken hands and a new fear of quiet places.

You reduced harm. You didn’t erase it.
endings.bad:
Security dismisses the flag as noise.
The window closes.

Systems can see patterns.
They can’t force people to care.

endings.good:
A warning hits the right nerve at the right moment.
Marisol delays. Finds a coworker. Leaves with witnesses.

Sometimes the smallest nudge does the most good.
endings.neutral: She receives it. Hesitates. Goes anyway.\n\nA warning is not a shield—only a chance.
endings.bad:
It arrives too late.

The system does not punish you.
Reality does.

endings.good:
A unit diverts immediately—rare alignment.
They intercept the threat before it becomes violence.

You got lucky.
Don’t build a strategy on luck.
endings.neutral:
Your report enters a queue.
Procedure is slower than harm.

By the time someone reads it, the moment has passed.
endings.bad: You act loudly, and you attract attention—without speed.\nThe threat slips through the same cracks you tried to use.

endings.good:
No intervention recorded.

Nothing happens.
Or nothing is captured.

The system doesn’t celebrate.
It only continues.
endings.neutral:
No intervention recorded.
Marisol survives. Trauma persists.

The city moves on.
She does not.
endings.bad:
No intervention recorded.
Violence occurs at 00:01.

Inaction is still a choice.
The system will remember it.
